Key Match Events: Sacramento Kings snapped a season-worst six-game losing streak with a 110-100 victory over the Dallas Mavericks
Sacramento used a 12-0 run to take a 45-44 lead with 5:23 left in the first half
Dallas answered with eight straight points and led 60-56 at the break
Sacramento ripped off a 17-2 surge to end the third quarter
Lyles buried consecutive 3-pointers early in the fourth quarter to give the Kings a 91-78 advantage with 9:11 left
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas played without Kyrie Irving (right shoulder soreness) and was without star Luka Doncic (left calf strain) for the third straight game
Klay Thompson (illness), Dereck Lively II (hip) and Naji Marshall (suspension) also were out
Others: Sacramento held a commanding 58-36 rebounding advantage while the Mavericks had a 13-1 edge in blocked shots
Quentin Grimes added 11 points and seven rebounds and Brandon Williams scored 10 points for the Mavericks
Sacramento shot 42 percent overall and was 10 of 32 from behind the arc
Dallas shot 42.1 percent from the field and were 12 of 31 from 3-point range
